text:
Welcome to How To Cook That i'm Ann Reardon and 
this is an episode of debunking where i take viral

hacks that you have sent me and I put them to the 
test to see if they are real. Today we have some

particularly dangerous ones but before we get to 
that this one was sent to me by so so many of you

the original post says avocados stay good forever 
if you put them in water in the fridge these have

been in here for two whole weeks while the control 
group on the counter rotted they're perfect i'm

speechless let's test it out i've bought a whole 
lot of avocados on the same day from the same

shop and i chose ones that are all still hard 
i'll put this row in the fridge let's put the top

row in water in the fridge a w for water and this 
bottom row is just going to be left on the counter

at room temperature pop those in the fridge 
there we go and four days later these are two

of the ones that were kept in water in the fridge 
they still look great they've got a nice texture

they can be sliced they look beautiful inside 
there's no discoloration on the outside they mash

beautifully and they look good they're fresh these 
are the ones that were just kept in the fridge not

in water and they look very much the same as the 
other ones they look really nice inside there's

no discoloration they look nice on the outside 
mash beautifully i can't tell any difference

now this one was the one that was on the 
counter and this is a different story

it's very discolored this one is not as discolored 
but it is still very very soft and you can see

even though these two avocados were stored in the 
exact same way this one looks quite a bit worse

and that's why i'm actually cutting open 
multiple avocados so that we can get an

accurate picture of what happens and then i left 
all of those for another 10 days to get us to day

14. here they all are the one that was stored 
in the water looks the best on the outside

but once you cut it open on the inside these two 
fridge ones are pretty indistinguishable to me

this fridge one is fairly soft but it's not 
crazy it's not really super soft it's good to use

and this is the fridge in water this 
particular avocado looks slightly

softer than the other one but once i opened 
multiple they're all very similar to each other

if i served these to you on a plate i just don't 
think you'd notice the difference between the two

can you tell which is which this is the one that 
was in water and this is the one that was just

in the fridge this one is obviously not the 
best way to store avocados don't just leave

them on your counter put them in the fridge 
but i wouldn't bother putting them in water

next lance sent me this video by met 
dan which shows how to make your own

power plug they take kinetic sand and push a plug 
into it to make a mold and then pour molten metal

into it add the usb cord and you have yourself 
a metal power plug wow that's dangerous i just

don't understand why people make these sort of 
videos well i do understand i understand they're

doing it for the outrage for the comments which 
increases engagement which increases views but

surely you'd have some level of moral conscience 
where do you go that's just wrong that's just

dangerous i just shouldn't do that like where's 
the line like there is no line obviously

well i'll make it so we can see what would happen 
i'm going to use tin because tin has a low melting

point so we can just melt it over the stove which 
looks like what they did because they just used

the coffee pot to melt it in when you're at 
a second hand store looking at weird things

if you happen to find something that's a dull 
silvery color flip it over and look for a stamp

that says pewter now modern pewter is 85 to 95 tin 
mixed with antimony and copper but be warned old

pewter contained lead especially before the 1970s 
and lead is highly toxic especially to your brain

so you don't want to melt anything with lead in it 
and breathe in those fumes especially if there's

children around with their developing brain just 
don't take any risks there so what you can do is

buy pure tin in a bag this cost me fifteen dollars 
or you can buy pewter this was four dollars and

just look for a stamp that says lead free or you 
can get a lead testing kit which will turn pink

or red if there's lead present so there's no lead 
in this one heat up a pan and add in the tin i got

this pan from the second hand store too because 
i don't want to ruin my fry pan and now while we

wait for that to melt let me thank the sponsor of 
this episode BetterHelp. BetterHelp is a platform

that helps connect you with a therapist. It's 
not for crisis care so if you're in a crisis

and you feel like you need that i'll put a link 
below that has a list of services that you can

contact in that situation but if you're feeling 
anxious or overwhelmed or you just need someone

to talk through stuff that's going on in your 
life right now then BetterHelp may be for you.

I spoke to a friend just a couple of weeks ago who 
felt like she needed just that, she needed someone

to talk through some stuff and she phoned a couple 
of clinics and was told there's a three month wait

list ... three months! BetterHelp can connect you 
with someone within 48 hours what you do is you

go to their website betterhelp.com/howtocookthat 
and it takes you through a short questionnaire.

now this is just designed to help match you with 
a licensed professional who's best suited to your

needs you could be matched with a psychologist a 
marriage and family therapist a clinical social

worker or a professional counselor and then 
it will ask you some questions about who you

would like to speak to if you have any preferences 
about that and then it goes over the details like

how much does it cost. It's billed monthly and for 
that you'll get one 30 minute session every week.

You can also message at any time and how quickly 
you get a response to that will depend on the

schedule of your individual therapist and you 
also get access to group seminars that a lot

of people find very useful there's all different 
topics in there as well now i'll put a link below

to BetterHelp and this is not an affiliate link 
meaning i do not get any money if you click on

that link it is just there for you so you can get 
10% off your first month when you first sign up.

Now let's check on our tin and see how that's 
going nothing's happened yet let me fast forward

a couple more minutes for you and now we have 
liquid tin this is not an activity for kids

tin melts at 232 celsius or 450 fahrenheit so much 
much much hotter than boiling water let me add the

tankard this is just amazing watching something so 
solid just melt down and disappear into a puddle

push the plug into the kinetic sand like they 
did now i'm not sure if glass is the best choice

for this because it is going to get pretty hot 
but anyway pull out the plug and now pour the

molten metal into the mold i'm not going to bother 
adding the usb cord because i know this won't work

then we're going to have to let that cool down 
while we're waiting let's melt some more things

now let me test if you can use a silicon mold 
for tin i know silicon can take high heat but

this would have to be at the maximum end pour 
it in is that smoke yes i'm not happy with that

smoke hopefully we don't get a hole and liquid 
tin running everywhere i decided to put the

whole thing into water just in case once it's 
cooled down tip it out and it actually worked

that's heaps better than i thought it would be 
give it a quick polish with a dremel and it looks

like this now that's pretty cool i'm going to 
have to give this away to one of my patrons so

if you're a patron head over to patreon.comh2ct 
and find out how to enter back to the plug

pull it out of the sand my sand is definitely not 
coming off as easily as theirs did and this is

still quite hot so let's drop it into some cold 
water and get that all off and look at that the

kinetic sand definitely casts really well it's a 
little bit bumpy or grainy looking on the edges

but that's understandable but even though this one 
is the right shape the proper one is completely

different on the inside you've got the plastic 
housing on the outside and then if i open it up

to show you what's inside you can see you have 
two separate wires coming from the two prongs so

wires are not joined together let me use batteries 
to illustrate what happens if the wires were to

cross so we've got our battery pack as the power 
source then we have our two wires coming out and

then you usually have an appliance here so in this 
case i'm just going to add a light bulb across

and you can see that the light bulb lights up 
and that's because we have a circuit and that

electrical current can flow around and that's what 
makes the globe light up but what would happen if

instead of having two separate wires here we have 
a solid metal plug then we can get current to flow

across here so if i add that you'll see the light 
bulb goes out if i take it off the light goes

back on and that's because the electricity 
likes to go the path of least resistance

so instead of going around and through the 
light bulb it's now mainly going this way

and i don't know if you can see on 
the camera but there is still a tiny

amount of current going through the globe but 
it's mainly going around this short circuit

and apart from the light going out it looks 
okay but here's what's really happening in

this diagram we have zero current flowing at 
the moment because there is no circuit if i

complete the circuit we now have 0.9 amps flowing 
around nicely and the light globe is turned on

now let's get another wire and add that across 
the middle and see the difference is not just the

path of current that's changed there's now a huge 
amount of current flowing because there's nothing

stopping it there's no load there's no resistance 
and this will eventually cause heat and a fire

now i can feel already that this battery pack 
is getting hot but to show you i'll put some

chocolate on the batteries and now you can see for 
yourself those batteries are getting pretty hot

and if i left them we could get smoke and a fire 
and i don't want to do that so i'll take that off

now these batteries are only 1.5 volts each 
whereas the power supply in australia is 240 volts

so think about how hot that is going to get 
how quickly that's going to happen if you

had this situation with the mains power rather 
than just the battery i have an extension cord

here and it's not plugged into anything there is 
no power because i don't want any power to flow

through me when i touch the metal now if i plug 
in the other end and turn it on three two one

we instantly lost power the reason for that 
is our house is fitted with an over current

protection device it's picking up that huge 
surge in current and immediately flicking the

breaker as a safety measure so that we don't get 
a fire and i'm grateful for that we also have a

residual current detection system which detects 
if any current is leaking from the system and

for example going into a human so that would flick 
off straight away as well in order to save lives

but not all older houses have 
those protective measures in place

a friend of ours when he was just a kid found 
out the hard way what happens if you don't have

those in place and i'm going to let him tell 
you his story so that we can all learn from it

hi anne and hi to all your subscribers thank you 
so much for joining us i was hoping that you could

share with us the story of when you were only six 
years old when you tried to fix the christmas tree

lights yeah like i had my little pocket knife i 
thought you know what i think the contacts for

it was like a two-part plug for the christmas tree 
lights needed a bit of a clean out and after that

should be good to go what i didn't realize is 
that that part that was connecting to the lights

and then that other end was connected to the wall 
behind the cabinet and i didn't know that it was

still plugged in there as soon as i made contact 
to clean out the little contacts on that plug

there it was this instant paralysis when there's 
an electric current that goes through your muscles

um it actually tenses up so once i made contact 
there muscles in my hand just locked up and it

was just no way i could actually let go what 
were you feeling at that stage do you remember

kind of feels like pins and needles kind of 
sensation but you can't breathe you can't

move you can't see anything you're just 
kind of feeling this like surge of power

just going through your body there so you've 
got electricity flowing through you you're

locked on with your hand you wouldn't have even 
been out of speak you're struggling to breathe

what did you do just with my mind i just cried out 
to like anyone just cried out to god god help me

and i believed he saved me that day it's 
amazing that you're still alive what happened

next i can't remember what happened for for 
a little bit there we had some visitors over

um our house from overseas and it's actually 
the smell of my burning flesh they actually

told them that something's wrong and then they 
came looking and they turned off the power

it took a little while for me to come too right 
here is where i actually had the pocket knife

and basically the skin there was just charred 
black if you kind of think of like burning your

steak to charcoal that's basically what it was 
the doctors were amazed um they were still alive

we're trying to work out um how to repair my hand 
my uncle would just dub me the miracle boy he

just couldn't believe you just don't see people 
you know who have these kind of scars because

one they're all dead or they've got stumps for 
hands definitely guys stick to cooking don't

cook yourself it's not worth it you know go buy a 
secondhand plug or something if you want to save

some money or buy one online it's not worth your 
life you want to keep living many years to come

you know cooking extraordinary things awesome 
thanks rayna such great advice so don't follow

that hack at best your short your power at worst 
you'll get really really hurt or you could even

die don't muck around with electricity it's just 
way too dangerous next i have this hack that was

sent into me by ian and this is a clip by crafty 
panda where they are trying to cook meat on molten

metal and then when they serve it up it even 
says safe to eat now i'm not sure exactly what

metal they're using at the start of the video 
it talks about melted aluminium and they have

a forge that they're melting things in but by the 
time they get to this point of the video they're

melting things just on the stovetop which would 
suggest it's probably tin so let's give it a go

i've got my melted tin add a piece of meat flip 
it over and it's done now if we take a closer

look it is cooked but it has chunks of metal on 
it that's really going to hurt your teeth if you

try and chew on it and if you got past that and 
swallowed it any of these sharp edges could cut

your throat or your intestines and if the metal 
was not food grade and absolutely totally pure

it could contain other metals that may be 
toxic like lead that was a definite fail

thank you so much to my patrons who make these 
videos possible if you have a hack that you'd like

description below make sure you do send a link

if you liked this episode make sure you
